bug.author: garrettwong
bug.summary: Deploy CLI `kfctl apply` fails due to `Network "default" requires specifying a subnetwork`.
bug.description:
/kind bug What steps did you take and what happened:
We have a requirement in our organization to use Shared VPC (an attached network that does not exist within the current GCP service project) I am following the instructions on https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/gke/deploy/deploy-cli/ I went through the instructions and made it all the way to the kfctl apply all -V step. The apply fails with the error message (below), inferring that the default project network is being referenced (which in my case is deleted). I've tried grep -r "networks/default" ." in the directory to find all references of the default network` and have replaced them to a Shared VPC network self link (with the full path and the partial paths)
https://www.googleapis.com/compute/v1/projects/${PROJECT}/global/networks/${NETWORK} projects/${PROJECT}/global/networks/${NETWORK}
I replaced the default network value in the 3 files that showed up:
gcp_config/storage.jinja .cache/kubeflow/kubeflow-0dbd2550372c003ba69069aeee283bd59fb1341f/testing/test_deploy.py .cache/kubeflow/kubeflow-0dbd2550372c003ba69069aeee283bd59fb1341f/deployment/gke/deployment_manager_configs/storage.jinja
ERRO[0027] Updating kubeflow-dir2 error: &{Code:RESOURCE_ERROR Location:/deployments/kubeflow-dir2/resources/kubeflow-dir2 Message:{"ResourceType":"gcp-types/container-v1beta1:projects.locations.clusters","ResourceErrorCode":"400","ResourceErrorMessage":{"code":400,"message":"Network "default" requires specifying a subnetwork.","status":"INVALID_ARGUMENT","statusMessage":"Bad Request","requestPath":"<denchmark-link:https://container.googleapis.com/v1beta1/projects/clgx-edg-dsa-poc-ed8c/locations/us-central1-a/clusters%22,%22httpMethod%22:%22POST%22%7D%7D>https://container.googleapis.com/v1beta1/projects/clgx-edg-dsa-poc-ed8c/locations/us-central1-a/clusters","httpMethod":"POST"}}</denchmark-link> ForceSendFields:[] NullFields:[]} filename="gcp/gcp.go:348" Error: couldn't apply KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: coordinator Apply failed for gcp: (kubeflow.error): Code 400 with message: gcp apply could not update deployment manager Error could not update deployment manager entries; Updating kubeflow-dir2 error(400): BAD REQUEST Usage: kfctl apply [all(=default)|k8s|platform] [flags] Flags: -h, --help help for apply -V, --verbose verbose output default is false couldn't apply KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: coordinator Apply failed for gcp: (kubeflow.error): Code 400 with message: gcp apply could not update deployment manager Error could not update deployment manager entries; Updating kubeflow-dir2 error(400): BAD REQUEST What did you expect to happen:
I was hoping that it would reference the Shared VPC network (not the default network) and deploy Kubeflow.
Anything else you would like to add: [Miscellaneous information that will assist in solving the issue.]
I'm thinking there could be a requirement on permissions into the Shared VPC network, which I will also do a bit more exploration around. Are there other Deployment Manager scripts that we are aware of that need to be updated accordingly? The error messages suggests specifying a subnet, but unfortunately, I'm not seeing any documentation around this at this time.
